brief_summary.textblock:
RATIONALE: Chemoprotective drugs such as carboxypeptidase-G2 may protect normal cells from
      the toxic effects of chemotherapy.

      PURPOSE: Clinical trial to study the effectiveness of carboxypeptidase-G2 in treating
      nervous system toxic effects in patients given an accidental overdose of intrathecal
      methotrexate.

clinical_study.brief_title: Carboxypeptidase-G2 in Treating Nervous System Toxic Effects in Patients Given an Overdose of Intrathecal Methotrexate
condition: Unspecified Adult Solid Tumor, Protocol Specific
Unspecified Childhood Solid Tumor, Protocol Specific

detailed_description.textblock:
OBJECTIVES:

        -  Determine the effectiveness of carboxypeptidase-G2 rescue in patients who develop life
           threatening methotrexate (MTX) neurotoxicity following accidental intrathecal MTX
           overdose.

        -  Study the CSF pharmacokinetics of MTX following rescue.

      OUTLINE: Patients undergo a lumbar puncture as soon as possible after methotrexate overdose
      to remove methotrexate and receive a single dose of carboxypeptidase-G2 intrathecally over 5
      minutes.

      Patients are followed for at least 1 month.

      PROJECTED ACCRUAL: A maximum of 10 patients will be accrued for this study.

criteria.textblock:
DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS:

          -  Patients who received an intrathecal overdose of methotrexate of 100 mg or more

        PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS:

        Age:

          -  Any age

        Performance status:

          -  Not specified

        Hematopoietic:

          -  Not specified

        Hepatic:

          -  Not specified

        Renal:

          -  Not specified

        Other:

          -  No prior anaphylactic reaction to carboxypeptidase-G2 administration

        PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY:

        Biologic therapy

          -  Not specified

        Chemotherapy

          -  See Disease Characteristics

        Endocrine therapy

          -  Not specified

        Radiotherapy

          -  Not specified

        Surgery

          -  Not specified

        Other

          -  Concurrent therapy allowed
